alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Niobrara, northwestern Goshen, northeastern Platte and east central Converse Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1245 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glendo, or 23 miles southeast of Douglas, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glendo, Manville, Keeline, Jay Em, Sibley Peak, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Glendo Reservoir, Two Moon Campground, Hartville and Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 100 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
